result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: Washington County
superAgency.notes: Defendant shall comply with conditions of Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael William Puhl

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael William Puhl in court.  Attorney John A Best in court for Michael William Puhl.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is resolved w/DPA recommended on both counts.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1 and Ct 2.  Court accepts pleas, withholds finding of guilt and approves deferred prosecution agreement.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 25, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on October 25, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Absolute sobriety. Not possess any firearms. No violent contact with S.A.P. Not reside at any residence where firearms are located. Any firearms to be surrendered to third party.

Defendant Michael William Puhl in court.  Attorney John A Best in court for Michael William Puhl.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim present. Counsel's first appearance. Counsel argues for bond modification.  Court questions victim.  Court amends condition of bond to no violent contact.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Motion for Discovery and Inspection & Demand for Discovery and Inspection

No possession of firearms at any time. Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with SAP or his/her residence. Not reside at any residence where firearms are located.  Surrender any firearms to 3rd party.

Defendant Michael William Puhl in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Court sets $650 cash bond previously posted. Not guilty plea entered by Court.Court appoints Atty John Best.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $100 per month commencing 9/15/2022.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
22R 016213; Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #16112 on  8/24/22
